most_active_tickets.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
Showing very big markdown in copilot

common_issues.title: Pieces OS & Desktop Startup Failure After Update
common_issues.description: Users are unable to launch Pieces Desktop after updating Pieces OS. The app gets stuck on "Ensure Core Dependencies - Retry Step".  The issue seems related to Pieces OS failing to start properly, potentially due to data directory issues on Windows. Reinstalling doesn't resolve the problem.  Logs indicate database initialization failure.  A potential fix involves deleting local Pieces data, but this risks data loss.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
related_issues.text: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update. stucks at loading ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. For over a month I have been unable to use **Pieces OS** or **Pieces Desktop**. The Pieces OS service stopped working (I assume after the last update), and since then the desktop app no longer starts properly. Whenever I try to launch, the `Pieces` process starts but never progresses further. In **Pieces Desktop** I only see the message: _Ensure Core Dependencies Retry Step_ I’ve seen another user reporting a similar issue, but my case seems different (I’m attaching logs below). Unfortunately, this is not the first time I’ve faced problems with Pieces.... I’ve already lost all my history/snippets about three times in the past (distinct bugs). This situation is quite frustrating. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install/update to the latest version of Pieces OS on Windows 11. 2. Launch Pieces Desktop. 3. Observe that the app does not open and gets stuck with the “Ensure Core Dependencies” message. ### Expected Behavior Pieces OS should start normally and allow Pieces Desktop to connect and function. ### Actual Behavior - Pieces OS process starts but hangs. - Pieces Desktop shows “Ensure Core Dependencies – Retry Step”. - Reinstalling from scratch does not solve the issue. ### System Information - **OS**: Windows 11 - **Processor**: Intel x64-based - **Pieces OS**: 12.2.1.0 - **Pieces Desktop**: 4.34 ### Troubleshooting Attempted - Tried reinstalling Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop from scratch → issue persists. - I noticed a similar issue has been reported, but I’m not sure it is directly related to what I’m experiencing. - I suspect that completely deleting all local data/configuration files could be a final solution, but this would cause me to lose all my snippets/history (which has already happened before). I’d prefer to avoid this unless it’s confirmed as the only fix. ### Logs [Support logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22142467/Support.zip) ### Additional... If this issue is already being tracked, that’s fine. If not, I’ll attempt to wipe all Pieces data and retry, though I suspect some leftover files/data may be blocking the reinstall. Thanks in advance for your support! Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Pieces OS, Desktop Application

* Operating System / Platform: Linux

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1





After installation, the “Initialize Desktop App” step has run successfully. The “Ensure core dependencies” step displays the message “Retry Step”.

Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

common_issues.title: Pieces OS and Desktop App Startup Failures
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing issues with Pieces OS and Desktop App failing to start after updates, primarily on Windows but also reported on Linux.  Symptoms include the app getting stuck on "Ensure Core Dependencies" step.  Reinstallation has not resolved the issue for some users.  One user reports large markdown blocks in Copilot responses making scrolling difficult.

related_issues.title: Showing very big markdown in copilot
related_issues.text: Showing very big markdown in copilot ### Software Desktop Application ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1 When I am sending questions to the Pieces copilot and it should respond with a block of code or a command to use the first one is very big and making it hard to scroll down to see the rest of the response. Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
related_issues.text:
Ensure core dependencies; Retry Step
### Checked for Existing Issues?

- [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this.

### Software

### Pieces OS, Desktop Application

* Operating System / Platform: Linux

* Pieces OS Version 4.3.1





After installation, the “Initialize Desktop App” step has run successfully. The “Ensure core dependencies” step displays the message “Retry Step”.
Error generating summary: 404 Publisher Model `projects/pi3c3s-cloud-server/locations/us-east1/publishers/google/models/gemini-pro` was not found or your project does not have access to it. Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

related_issues.title: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update.  stucks at loading
related_issues.text: Pieces OS & Pieces Desktop fail to start after last update. stucks at loading ### Checked for Existing Issues? - [x] Yes, I have checked existing issues and cannot find one related to this. ### Software Desktop Application, Pieces OS ### Operating System / Platform Windows ### Your Pieces OS Version 12.2.1.0 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. For over a month I have been unable to use **Pieces OS** or **Pieces Desktop**. The Pieces OS service stopped working (I assume after the last update), and since then the desktop app no longer starts properly. Whenever I try to launch, the `Pieces` process starts but never progresses further. In **Pieces Desktop** I only see the message: _Ensure Core Dependencies Retry Step_ I’ve seen another user reporting a similar issue, but my case seems different (I’m attaching logs below). Unfortunately, this is not the first time I’ve faced problems with Pieces.... I’ve already lost all my history/snippets about three times in the past (distinct bugs). This situation is quite frustrating. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Install/update to the latest version of Pieces OS on Windows 11. 2. Launch Pieces Desktop. 3. Observe that the app does not open and gets stuck with the “Ensure Core Dependencies” message. ### Expected Behavior Pieces OS should start normally and allow Pieces Desktop to connect and function. ### Actual Behavior - Pieces OS process starts but hangs. - Pieces Desktop shows “Ensure Core Dependencies – Retry Step”. - Reinstalling from scratch does not solve the issue. ### System Information - **OS**: Windows 11 - **Processor**: Intel x64-based - **Pieces OS**: 12.2.1.0 - **Pieces Desktop**: 4.34 ### Troubleshooting Attempted - Tried reinstalling Pieces OS and Pieces Desktop from scratch → issue persists. - I noticed a similar issue has been reported, but I’m not sure it is directly related to what I’m experiencing. - I suspect that completely deleting all local data/configuration files could be a final solution, but this would cause me to lose all my snippets/history (which has already happened before). I’d prefer to avoid this unless it’s confirmed as the only fix. ### Logs [Support logs.zip](https://github.com/user-attachments/files/22142467/Support.zip) ### Additional... If this issue is already being tracked, that’s fine. If not, I’ll attempt to wipe all Pieces data and retry, though I suspect some leftover files/data may be blocking the reinstall. Thanks in advance for your support! Please ensure you are using a valid model version. For more information, see: https://cloud.google.com/vertex-ai/generative-ai/docs/learn/model-versions

recommendations: Prioritize resolving the "Pieces OS & Desktop Startup Failure After Update" issue, given its high frequency and impact on users.
Investigate the root cause of the startup failures, focusing on data directory issues on Windows and database initialization problems.
Provide clear instructions or a troubleshooter for users experiencing startup issues, including steps to check data directories and potentially reset local data (with data loss warnings).
Improve communication with users experiencing startup issues, acknowledging the problem and providing updates on progress towards a fix.
Address the issue of large markdown blocks in Copilot responses to improve user experience.
